Package org.grapheditor.editor

In this packet and all its subpackages there is classes that have something to do with the grapheditor.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
InformationPane An interface thet represents an information pane that has a message stack.
MessageListener This listener interface can be added to a MessageProvider to listen for messages that is set for the provider.
 

Class Summary
ExpandDialog  
GraphEditorCellViewFactory This class extends DefaultCellViewFactory in JGraph and overrides the method createVertexView to return a cutom vertex view.
GraphEditorConstants This class overrides GraphConstants to add methods for some addisional constants.
GraphEditorPane This class represents a graph editor pane used to edit and view graphs.
GraphEditorPaneMouseAndMotionListener This class represents a mouse motion listener for a JGraph component that has the properties of the default one plus the additional future that it is possible to merge two vertices if the graph is not in insert mode and they are dragged togheter.
GraphEditorUndoManager This is an undo manager for the graph editor.
GraphEditorVertexView Thics class overrides VertexView to customize the view
KeyHandler This class is a keyhandeler that is added to the graph component GraphEditorPane to add some key operations.
MarqueeHandler Extends the BasicMarqueeHandler to add some extra functionality.
MessageProvider This class represents a message provider.
RotateDialog This is a dialog to rotate vertices in a graphPane.
SplitSelectedEdgesDialog A dialog that is used to deside how many vertices is going to be placed between vertices when the operation split edges has been called.
 

Package org.grapheditor.editor Description

In this packet and all its subpackages there is classes that have something to do with the grapheditor. In the packet there is the class GraphEditorPane which extends the class JGraph and represents the actual graph editor component. Many of the classes in this package extend from classes in the JGraph library to override their functionallity.
